review_title: What were you expecting? Much better than most reviews say
review_detailed_main: I don't understand why so many are giving this film 1 or 2 stars. What in the hell were you expecting? I think reviewers are being too hard on this one. This is a low-budget schlock sci-fi horror B-film. If you enjoy B-film horror and creature features you will enjoy this. Is it good? No, but it's fun.
I thought I'd switch off after 30 minutes because of the reviews here. Also because of star rating 3.5. But the movie is better than expected.

Doom Annihilation is a "basic with a B grade" horror sci fi.

Low budget, basic effects and lean on the story front. In other words this is a no frills flick that has limited appeal. It might be alright for a very slow rainy day but personally, I can think of a long list of things that would come well ahead of watching this again.

The acting is ok but again nothing and no one really stands out. 4/10.

review_title: By far worse then the rock doom.
review_detailed_main:
Makes the rock doom look like a masterpiece.

All copies of this film need collected up and buried at sea in a locked vault..

That's all I need to say. 👍

Good: Lots of attention to the set designs, very Doomy, even though it didn't always look great. Some practical FX were decent. Some external CGI shots of the base and ship were pretty ok. Um... There were two, maybe three, capable actors that did a 'decent' job.

Bad: Literally everything else. This a groan-inducing train wreck of a movie that spits in the face of any Doom fan. The easter eggs were terrible. The lead actress was abysmal. The script and story were Sharknado worthy.

Avoid unless you're looking for a laughable film to heckle with friends

review_title: Cheap, Flat, Ridden With Clichés & Disrespectful of the Source Material
review_detailed_main:
I think we all knew this was going to proper bad - low budget, cheap actors, mediocre director & no involvement from the authors of the original concept and all the games. Bad it was.

The very start states quickly what kind of thing will follow, the first shot is full of grade b cgi and even the opening titles were zero-budget style. We get introduced to a bunch of painfully clicheic characters (carried out by stiff acting) and plotline, surrounded by plasticky looking props and sets, effortless cinematography, boring color grading and so on and so forth. The special FX is mix of cheap cgi and practical fx that don't impress much. References to the contents of the games are there, a few, but to no satisfaction. So it continues for 90 minutes, from time to time entertaining us with emotionless and uninspiring action sequences. Oh, and the original score can be described the same way. There is some amount of much needed gore, but not creative enough or just simply not enough of it to compensate for anything. As the movie passes by, You find yourself predicting events and not caring for any of the characters - most you're going to feel is cringe or anger, if you're a "Doom" game franchise fan. You're also going to be very bored.

I loved "Doom 3", have played it through for three times & if there's anything good "Doom: Annihilation" did is inspiring me to play one of the games again. I'm recommending a hard pass on this absolutely lame and disappointing game adaptation. My rating: 2/10.

review_title: Another awful video game movie to add to the evergrowing heap.
review_detailed_main:
When I first heard that another DOOM movie was being worked on I was baffled; I assumed that after the terrible reception that the first film received, we would never see another attempt at making a DOOM movie (something that I was perfectly fine with, mind you). However, I was willing to give it the benefit of the doubt; perhaps this time they would try to remain faithful to the source material and present us with a gloriously over the top action film reminiscent of the fantastic CGI trailer for DOOM (2016). After learning that it was going to be a direct to dvd film with a low budget, all my good will for the film dried up. The dreadful trailer and the absence of DOOMGUY failed to win back any enthusiasm.

The premise involves a group of UAC marines being dispatched to a station on the planet Phobos for security duty. On this station, a group of scientists, engineers, and researchers are experimenting with teleportation and, of course, everything goes horribly wrong. After having one of their scientists test out the teleporter and returning deformed, Dr. Betruger, the one overseeing the operation, decides that it would be a brilliant idea to send himself in next. This causes the station to experience a power surge and demons begin to invade. The marines arrive and must now attempt to bring the station back online and figure out what exactly happened here.

This sets up a rather dull film. A good portion of it is spent with the marines moving through brightly lit corridors halfheartedly pointing their guns at every corner and exchanging dreadful dialogue. None of the marines are interesting or memorable; they're all just a bunch of walking military cliches that we've seen countless times in other sci-fi horror films.

The dialogue consists mainly of cheesy action movie phrases and painfully awkward references to the games (example: a character refers to himself as an "ultra nightmare", which is a difficulty setting in the game series). For people that are unfamiliar with the source material, these constant references will have them scratching their heads and wondering why the dialogue is so unnatural. Fans of the games will find themselves rolling their eyes at these forced references.

The acting is stiff and lifeless, with the only exceptions being Dominic Mafham, who plays Dr Betruger, and Clayton Adams, who plays a marine named Winslow. Everyone else looks bored.

I honestly couldn't tell what tone this movie was trying to go for. It fails to evoke any feelings of dread or horror because the entire station is lit up like a Christmas tree, and there isn't any proper ambiance. If it was trying to be a horror film, why not make it like DOOM 3? A game that features a dark and rich atmosphere filled with gory visuals and accompanied by some truly fantastic sound design that succeeds in immersing you into its world. Whatever. After meandering around for a about an hour, the film shifts gears and turns into a lame action movie.

The choreography for the action scenes is clumsy and disjointed, and I found myself dozing off during most of them. The outfits for the marines are unconvincing and cheap; they look like they are wearing airsoft gear. The CGI for the demons looks like something out of an amateur YouTube video.

If you're as big of a fan of the DOOM series as I am, do yourself a favor and skip this movie. You won't lose sleep over missing out on this. If you're not familiar with the series, this film will be a waste of time for you.

I played doom with my cousin in 1995. The movie borrows from the game, a title and a few loose details. The female lieutenant is clueless and not believable. The last 10 minutes are absolutely horrible. The writer director should try another career.

This movie makes me think it was a cheap way to hold on to the movie rights. Just avoid this and save yourself some time

review_title: Actually better than the Movie at some parts
review_detailed_main: I have been a long time fan of Doom since it was a free share game on the net back in the early 1990s, and the ironic thing is, this contrasted at some points heavily compared to the movie, but in a good way. Whereas the film had more CGI that was high quality, better known actors and something of a script that resembled a film, it still was not as good as it could have been, actually deviating from the story of the game. HOWEVER, this newest take on the franchise actually stayed much truer to the very games themselves, allowing people to see the maze like corridors and sub sections that the players would normally have gone through in the classic installments of the Doom franchise. Though not the best idea to have a very slender young woman as the main character, she was still enjoyable to watch for the most part, and the movie progressed in a really cool way by the end that was much more satisfying than the film was. That being said, the film wasa teensy bit more badarse with all its flare. Nonetheless, I like Doom annihilation. 5.5/10

review_title: more video game than video games
review_detailed_main:
This movie achieves something interesting: it feels more like a silly game than the actual game does. What I mean is, although it certainly isn't always true anymore, older video games had a reputation for focusing more on the gameplay aspects like puzzles and combat than on things like a cohesive plot and character building. Movies, even movies based on video games, focused more on the story because story and visuals were their primary tools for entertaining people. So the cliche that developed was that games were where you fell in love with a game world, but movies were the vehicle that made the inhabitants and their lives "real".

Over the years the gaming industry has made huge strides towards creating engaging and beautiful stories that integrate with gameplay, like Naughty Dog's 'The Last Of Us'. The movie industry, on the other hand, possibly because they more easily minimize language and cultural barriers, has increasingly found that movies with basic, uncomplicated plots can appeal to vast audiences in places like China. They have followed that trend by making films that are almost exclusively about the visuals, with almost non-existent plot and character development.

This movie is like seeing that original cliche come full circle. The plot of the latest Doom game, while admittedly pretty straight forward, it is an FPS after all, is at least as sophisticated as the plot of this movie, if not more so. And because this was a low budget film, the visuals are really awful, while with the settings maxed the Doom game looks pretty good. So here we are, with a movie that looks more like the cliche of a game than the game itself!

Needless to say, this movie is pure garbage; I would avoid it. If you want to watch a "Doom" movie, I'd suggest heading to YouTube instead and watching someone's 'movie' run (these typically just include the cut scenes and major events and clip out most of the combat, etc.) of the latest version of the game.

review_title: This is almost a competitor to Dragonball Evolution
review_detailed_main:
Another review states that this movie spits in the face of Doom fans and I agree. The sets are cheap, the acting is bad, the effects are just pathetic, and nothing is true to the source material. References are just cheaply tossed in, like dead bodies having names of ID staff/characters, some jackass saying "I'm your ultra-nightmare", a plasma rifle just called the BFG that shoots green projectiles which don't chunkify anything. It was a waste of time, and if I had paid money to watch this I would have demanded a refund and lit my money on fire right there because it would have been more entertaining.

It's not even good for a laugh. It's not Dragonball Evolution levels of bad, but damn if they didn't try hard to compete with it.
Aside from the chainsaw scene and Betruger the rest of this movie was absolutely horrendous (the two positives I said deserve at least an 8/10 but everything else deserves nothing higher than a 2/10)

Doom: Annihilation (1 out of 5 stars).

Doom: Annihilation is a terrible video game adaptation of the series which does not do anything to improve from 2005 Doom movie. This film really makes other video game adaptations movies like 2005 Doom feel like a masterpiece or even the Resident Evil movie series is well done. Doom Annihilation is a poor adaptation of the game. The script and direction is laughable bad and cheesy. The dialogue is horrible. The story is generic of the premise with nothing more to it. Besides scientists at UAC opened up a portal releasing the monster looking things from the game that throws fireballs at the people and infecting nearby scientists into zombie like things.

The plot is generic. Besides a rescue squad of soldiers going into the laboratory to discover that incident and trying to contain. The ending is even worse if it is trying to end for a sequel but it is cheesy.

The script is terrible with bad dialogue. The soldiers seemed more amateurs as a team than being professional. The direction is horrible with dull action sequences. And characters making stupid decisions. I really did miss the first person shooting sequence in 2005 Doom movie which was well done.

The acting is horrible with a cast of unknown actors. The visual effects are low budget terrible. The games animation seemed more realistic.

Overall, Doom: Annihilation is one of the worst films ever. The action, direction, acting, and plot is just one of those bad adaptations of the game.

Not only it was a too much focused on feminism but the story itself didn't respect the original story of Doom 3 or Doom 2016 or any other doom game for that matter. Did the producers think that they are better than the writers of the story to change it?? Arrogance... They learned no lesson from the first Doom 2005 movie. That movie changed the demons with people infected with some viruses. Now this Doom changed the epic DOOM GUY with a Doom woman and on top of that, not once does anyone in the entire movie refer to the demons as demons or to the portals as Hell. On the contrary, they are portrayed as some sort of aliens from another planet. Wow just wow.... had they respected the original story, despite the low budget, it could have been a better film with a higher rating and thus higher profits.

Why make a movie based off a source (any, be it abook, comic book, video game, etc.) and then make it absolutely nothing like the source? Did the horrible rating and reviews of that last abortion named DOOM not teach you anything? So, why did the same formula get used again?!?

Did the dork who made this second piece of garbage EVER even look at online pictures of DOOM? I'm guessing "no", because, beyond the name, there was nothing DOOM related in the movie.

Pay attention, idiot film makers. DOOM is about Mars being a gateway to hell. It is NOT another stupid zombie virus movie of which there is already wayyyyyy too many. Demons NOT zombies. No stupid virus, no blue skinned neck biters.

If you want to add yet another overused zombie movie to the mountains of crappy existing zombie movies, just make a stinking zombie movie and don't fill DOOM fans with hope, only to piss them off. Because, duh, the majority of people that will watch a DOOM movie is fans of the game.

This movie SUCKED. I hated it even more than that last one, which I really hated.

review_title: AWESOME SCI-FI HORROR, LOTS OF FUN & VERY ENTERTAINING
review_detailed_main:
This new version of "Doom" was a really nice surprise!!! It was made on a low budget but looks fantastic, it's good entertainment.

I got good sci-fi movie vibes with this Doom: Annihilation, i saw hints of "Aliens" & "Ghosts Of Mars" & "Resident Evil" all Excellent films & "Doom" fits in nicely with this Awesome bunch!!!

First off i have to say again how good this film looks for a lower budget straight to dvd B-movie flick, the production design is excellent!!! The music is very cool & the acting is mostly really good & the practical monster fx are Amazing, it's so nice to see rubber suit creatures on screen again, reminded me of old school 80's & 90's style & the Demon creatures are really cool looking!!! I know this is based on the old 90's computer game but i don't really know that, so i only go by this as a movie & as a sci-fi Horror Thriller it's great fun. The main positive thing about this film is it's Entertaining!!!

Our tough Hero/Lead is "Joan Dark" played by Amy Manson who gives a moody & no-nonsense tough performance that's totally believable, she's Cool character & another standout Cool Character is the marine Captain "Savage" played by British actor James Weber Brown, he's a tough Shotgun wielding action hero while he's on screen!!! The rest of the cast of Marines & scientists are all pretty decent & solid on screen with lots of mixed accents that make the ensemble cast interesting.

This is a nice simple story about a group of scientists who discover an Alien teleportation device & open up the gateway that then unleashed Demonic creatures & a team of space Marines are sent to the strange moon type planet to check out what's happened, that's basically the plot but there's other bits & bobs going on but the main focus is seeing Cool marines fighting possessed scientists & Demon creatures that have taken over the space station base.

There's lots of Awesome action scenes & lots of old school gory blood splattered gore, like demonic people getting cut up with a chainsaw!!! & lots of Demons getting shot to bits & Marines getting ripped to pieces & throats ripped open, it's an Awesome old school blood bath!!! Of course there's alot of C.g.i stuff as the film goes on but it looks excellent for a limited budget film like this!!! There's a nice mix of practical rubber fx & the usual flashy c.g.i stuff but it all gels well together to look fantastic on screen. The moonbase station looks really good & the spaceships look Awesome, everything seems to be lovingly crafted to look the best it possibly can for the cost of what they had to create it all. Doom is a very enjoyable sci-fi Horror that's actually alot better than some of the huge budget blockbuster movies that hit the cinema!!! Also "Doom" has a nice pacing & an eerie isolated atmosphere. The marines look Cool as hell & the Demons are scary & ferocious beasts & some shoot fire balls!!!

Doom: Annihilation is a fun & exciting action packed sci-fi Horror movie, it's also great late night entertainment.
Brainless and unlikable characters everywhere, stupid plot and cheap acting. This garbage should never have been made.
Can I give a movie less than one star? I love movies that are so bad that they're good, but this movie is just bad.

review_title: When you have time to kill
review_detailed_main: If you ever have an 1.5 hrs to kill this is your movie. The dialogue is shawty at best, the graphics are expected of a low budget film, and the whole film itself screams let's make a few more dollars off of Doom fans. The only and I mean only redeeming quality of this film is the choreographed fight sequences. There have been bigger budget films that have way worse fight scenes than this film. Makes me wonder if they hired a bunch of UFC fighters turned actors for this film.

The cast know nothing of acting as if they are military nor do they look it. Somehow fully trained soldiers are taken out by blueish zombies, which are not in the DOOM video game. No DOOM marine only compounds the terrible decisions that were made in this film. The UAC soldiers wear sad paintball looking outfits that do not resemble the gear in the games what so ever. The majority of the acting is as stated in other reviews poor and stale. I enjoy B movies and other movies so bad they are enjoyable but this is not really enjoyable. This was a meal that had no sweetness, savory, or really any flavor at all.
I like the action and storyline. I want to see more like the guns and monsters.

review_title: It's better then the last Doom
review_detailed_main:
This one actually follows the game lore. The UAC is doing crazy experiments with portals on Phobos which go horribly wrong. Now a group of marines is going to land there end up in the mix. So we have a good start.

The characters are just okay. Doom is using all the cliches as predictable as they may be.(I loved the easter eggs like each security card was blue, yellow or red) Who's going to live who's going to die? Yeah that's pretty easy to figure out in the first 10 minutes if you've ever seen a movie like this. It still manages to have some intense scenes and good action sequences.

It's low budget but I was hoping for more creatures, that's one of the best parts of the game, but they only use zombies and imps. I will give major props to the imp costumes, they were real and in camera and looked great versus anything cgi. The BFG was used and at first it was ok, near the end I was like hell yeah that's a BFG.

If you're a Doom fan like I am and also like low budget sci fi horror, Then I think you'll have you'll have a good time. but when it's over you'll wonder, wait if they didn't land then there was no problem at all? The movie is a mess but good for doom fans.

Such a shame...it has so much potential... Doom was one of my favourite games...this movie really destroyed perfectly good memory of the great game.

Lousy acting. Bad storyline...should be renamed DOOMED!

Im just gonna bullet point this: Pros- Set design isnt too bad Box art for the physical copy is okay Good paper weight Could probably scrape the ice off your car in the morning

Cons- Bad acting Costumes are aweful Plot was done better in the 2005 (granted there was no hell in the 2005 version and it was about human genetics) CGI was naff NO DOOM GUY Worse than the 2005 one (bearing in mind i really enjoyed Doom 2005)
Why would ID software lend their title for this low budget, direct to DVD fest? Borrows heavily from ALIENS. Female protagonist was absolutely unnecessary. Wish they did better.

review_title: Painfully bad yet mediocre in some aspects
review_detailed_main: The acting and cinematography are atrocious! I started Doom: Annihilation several weeks ago and got bored so here I am watching the rest because I'm a huge movie buff and figure I give it a chance. It's filmed so poorly like a 2 AM late night movie lol. So much of the dialogue is ridiculous although the last half is pretty enjoyable!

Found this while looking threw Netflix and was super excited to see it. Clicked on it felt like the game for the first 15 minutes. Then they say hey let's put a small none intimidating women so the feminist can fill good about how they messed up another movie.
Stronk wahmen who need no man, and idiotic male characters. Just standard Hollywood woke garbage. I just saved you from wasting your time, you are welcome.

Don't believe the low raters here; if they want to be snobbish, let them. You will enjoy this film! Good 'Doom' Action, well acted and well paced. Criticisms: For 'marines', their reaction time sucks! A Real Marine would shoot much faster, even when presented with a creepy life-form. I was overjoyed when they brought in the ole BFG-9000! If you don't know what B..F..G stands for, well, I've no help for you. (Hint: Big F... Gun) Back in the day, we all played Doom, using the Company's network to play against each other at lunchtime. Doom was ALWAYS great fun. Video games, like movies, come & go, but Doom set new standards for those of us who like shoot-em-ups. This film brought back fond memories for me. I like this version of film-Doom better, I think, than the last one with "The Rock". Try as I can to recall that version -- The Rock came off as just a bit corny for me. That does not happen in this film. Enjoy.

review_title: Honestly Not Bad and Pleasantly Surprised
review_detailed_main:
Let's start with history to establish some perspective. If you can make a movie based on a video game with a $60 million dollar budget with an A-List actor (and former wrestler) and still have it be terrible, I doubt you can do worse with a low budget reboot. Because of that, don't expect gold as this flick has "B-Movie" written all over it. You see it with the no-name actors, the same redressed corridor sets for different scenes, cheesy dialogue indicative of the limited budget they were working with, and the CGI that was silly at best.

If you can get past that, you'll encounter a plot of space marines being routinely sent in for base security, only to discover a "situation" and investigate. They make no shortage of references to the Doom franchise which is nice but what I really enjoyed is the "unexpected". That is, you actually see these marines doing marine stuff (e.g. hand-to-hand fighting, etc.) and midway through the movie, you'll wonder why it appears the movie is about to end when it's just getting interesting.

They didn't shoehorn a strong female heroine in the name of feminism but instead had a nonchalant display similar to Sigourney Weaver in Aliens (1986) and Linda Hamilton in T2 (1991). The movie's look and feel isn't incessantly dark and terror-filled like the game and this movie takes place on the Martian moon Phobos instead of on Mars (like the game).

I don't believe this flick was made to redeem the franchise from the cinematic disaster that was Doom (2005) but it's definitely an interesting re-imagined story. If you decide to pull the trigger, just turn your brain off and enjoy it.

review_title: This was way better than 2005 one

review_detailed_main:
Let's acknowledge that this was nothing else but a cheap attempt at keeping the adaptation rights at Universal. Or at least, for me, that's the only way the existence of this... series of images and sounds is justified. This is clearly neither a work of love, nor a dimwitted attempt at having fun with the IP. This is a boring, soulless, pointless exercise in near-zero budget cinema.

Ok, granted, Doom is not the headiest game IP ever, but there is mysiticism, gory fun, body horror, straight-up hardcore knee-deep-in-bowels action and big stakes in the original game series. With such rich source material I am baffled how this lukewarm, middling, unoriginal and, above all, BORING adaptation ever came to be. Like, you have to consciously work on delivering such a bland screenplay.

All, and I literally mean, ALL dialog is recycled from far better movies. The leading lady's (Joan Dark -- is this meant to be a funny dig at Joan D'Arc? Seriously? Was this written by stoner college kids?) acting and delivery rivals an unpolished oak desk working for UPS. Is it possible to have negative chemistry with everyone? She certainly makes it possible.

Everyone else is completely forgettable, apart from the big bad, whose... twist? is perfectly obvious from the minute he shows up after the shutdown. At least he puts in true, 100% all-natural ham when everyone else is clearly just baloney. He chews more scenery than the acid from the Alien.

Music, cinematography, VFX? Who cares. Soulless, but serviceable.

It's a bloody mess, literally and figuratively. And it clearly ends with the intention of a sequel. But why? Doom: Annihilation certainly succeeded in one aspect: it annihilated the IP for the movies.

review_title: This is what the Left and Hollywood are doing. Less than 1 star.
review_detailed_main: I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone, well maybe if I wanted to get them for something... but I'm not that person. Can't believe I wasted time trying to watch it. Go on read so more reviews before you waste your time.

In my opinion it's regular, worth seeing one Sunday afternoon, but the first trailer left a very bad impression that generated a wave of disgust among fans and spectators in general.

The ideas that the director had for this film were diminished by the budget of this, which leaves me the following conclusion, to be a film with references to other FPS and with a different name to DOOM, it would have been ok, but carring DOOM In his name, it doesn't match.

Worst representation of a "military unit" ever. Did they even have any kind of military advisor?

It's DOOM in name only. Very much a hodge podge of generic movie tropes haphazardly tossed together .

review_title: And the worst movie award goes to ....... DOOM: Annihlation!
review_detailed_main:
Seriously thanks for wasting my time and minutes of my life I will never get back.

Hopefully in the future these people can be held liable for scamming/wasting our time and trying to cash in on a previous successful franchise / game / movie title.

The movie is worthless avoid, go watch DOOM 2005 instead (or whatever), can't be any worse then this. (even the description is off, hell?, demons?, where was this?, I'm sure it wasn't this movie.

This is another example where Feminists are a bunch of untalented leeches sucking off the teet of previous successful titles, these people are utterly useless in the movie industry and only RUIN great potential titles (Ie DOOM, Predator, star wars..etc), They have absolutely 100% no talent and can't come up with their own story/movie/ideas all they know how to do is ruin the works of others....

This movie is such a disrespect to fans and non fans alike it should be recalled and removed and everyone refunded + compensated for having to endure this trash, I just hope people really listen to the 1 star reviews because it is that bad.

The sets/costumes/CGI are actually pretty believable. The Phobos moon station was looked legitimate and provided a nice backdrop for the plot to unfold. However, the acting is subpar, most lines sounded like they were reading straight from a script. The main actress wasn't terrible, but as a whole it was cringeworthy. The actual storyline had purpose and flow, but there were a few tangents that could have been cut.

This movie makes first Doom a masterpiece. That's all. Simple, right? I only recommend to watch this if you're watching another movie at the same time. After five minutes you'll focus on the other one. Even Steven Seagal's movies have more budget and quality.

review_title: This is not a video game
review_detailed_main: If you don't compare this movie with video game of DOOM, you will like it, you must watch this movie without previous thinking. Because this is not a video game, we can't expect everything. Watch as a movie. Have fun.

Before watching this I was looking forward to a movie so bad its good. I'm one of those people that view The Room as a master work of cinema and find Neil Breen's deconstruction of modern societal values in his Magnum opus Pass Through as a much needed mirror on the World.

So I was surprised to ended up genuinely enjoying Doom:Annihilation. Its low budget but they spend it in the right place's.

There was also zero politics despite what the on-line reactions were claiming. Honestly I thought the same when I heard there was going to be no Doom guy and the lead would be female. Plus the trailer really didn't help.

Now Hollywood is agenda heavy of late and it is getting annoying but I didn't see it in this. If it's there they hid it well which isn't likely given the B movie script.

The lead was a bad-ass. A woman closer to Black Widow or the full metal b*#$h from "Live, Die, Repeat" not a miss man character at all.

If low budget sci-fi horror is your thing its worth the watch.

Can somebody please give me back my 6$ please. this is a disgrace to the game and the first movie. At least the first movie held my interest this is like a cheap syfy rip off. Nothing happens at all. The gore is trash. the effects are from the 90s. The plot is the same as the rocks version but recycled. What a wasted.

review_title: I was DOOMED to watch the whole thing...
review_detailed_main: Only so I could write an honest review.... and that is... Pathetic. Horrible. Waste of time. Low budget. Horrible CGI. Mega chips on shoulders. That must be what makes their bullets 10,000 times stronger than other ones. Zero charisma from "leaders". Tossing around bad words does not make you tough or a leader. Almost laughable. 'nuf said.
Was really looking forward to a new Doom movie. But this was not it...

review_title: The single most uninspired film I've ever seen.
review_detailed_main:
Here's a litany of words that perfectly describes this movie: cheap, schlocky, tedious, annoying, lazy, pedestrian, random, flaccid, turgid, chaotic, and just flat out stupid.

This is the most uninspired movie I've ever seen. The production design is bland and limited. The editing is stilted. The action scenes are jumbled and come out of nowhere. The special effects are straight out of 1995. The characters are grating. And everything that happens is ultimately pointless.

Words of advice: ANY MOVIE with the subtitle Annihilation is ALWAYS AWFUL!
Total garbage. Its fun to watch if you enjoy laughing at horrible writing and high-school level production.

This Film has nothing to do with the game DOOM or the 2005 film, it has terrible acting, horrible special effects, unlikeable characters, bad dialogue, and an incomprehensible plot. It's clear that this dumpster fire was hastily slapped together at the last moment In an effort to maintain the IP.

If anyone from Netflix is reading this, can I get a free month for watching this movie? Also, please don't greenlight a Halo movie if this is what y'all are going to do to it. Master Chief doesn't deserve this. Neither did Doomguy really.

review_title: Still better than the big budget one
review_detailed_main:
Don't really understand all the criticism written here. What were you expecting from a low budget related to a 'in your face' shooting fps game? And to be honest you should look at it from all the limitations they were facing when bringing this up. For a low budget. they kept it simple without adding horrifying cgi, the scenarios looked pretty ok, acting nothing more nor less than expected, no need to add braless women, and certainly you see more of the game items in this movie than in Rock's one.

Keep it up

review_title: From the same director as Soccer Dog: The movie...
review_detailed_main:
I had no clue that this movie could be this bad. It's just awful.

I didn't expect perfection but this is as bad or worse than most SciFi channel productions. Terrible acting, terrible props, and the CGI looks like it was done in 1999. The whole movie is honestly a waste of money.

Why was there so much damn story? Literally all someone needs to do to make a good DOOM movie is start with a Space Marine in the prison on Mars, bad things happen, he gets out, and he fights his way to the end of the movie learning things along the way.

No redeeming qualities. This movie was beyond terrible, don't waste your time.
This movie looks like crap , all the actors are flat and boring and nothing happens for what feels like forever. Nothing like the game except in name alone

To claim this is from the Video Game is blasphemy, cant believe anyone thought this was even a good idea and I couldn't even bare to waste my life watching the rest, didnt get half way through and already saw the downhill it was going
At first I thought it was a joke! Worst movie ever. What they are thinking!! Waste of money!!

As an outsider not knowing (or caring) about anything Doom related, I had no high hopes for this movie and did not know what to expect. I read the bad reviews and sought out any good reviews to see if there were any redeeming qualities to this movie. Ultimately I expected something not top quality, and I was hoping that if it's not that good, at least it might be unintentionally funny due to how bad it might be, like the movie "Airplane vs Volcano". That movie was so bad in every way that it was actually enjoyable to watch while talking about everything that's bad about it. But that is not the case for Doom. It was semi enjoyable, but then it started to get stupid, but not stupid enough to just laugh at it. Just stupid enough to get a little frustrated with it and want to write a review about it. So bottom line, if you don't expect too much, you won't be too disappointed. Good enough to watch if you have absolutely nothing else to watch.

SPOILER ALERT IN 3,2,1... Stop reading if you don't want to know.

(Okay, resume countdown, 3,2,1...) When the female marine stared to fight off hords of the creatures by herself, even in hand to hand combat and annihilating them so easily, while the much bigger, stronger fellow marines just died so easily when attacked by only one creature, that's when the movie started to go downhill for me. Also, she was out of ammunition and began fighting in hand to hand combat. Then when the fighting was over you can see that she had several clips on her person that she could have used but didn't. Things like that started adding up and becoming annoying, but unfortunately not ridiculous enough to begin enjoying it for how bad it was or as a spoof.
This is actually worse than Uwe Boll's interpretation.

Does nobody knows how to make a Doom movie? It's very simple, develop a story around a marine with a good background and emotional plot.

Anyone remembers Phonebooth?? Hour and a half from Colin Farrell stuck in a Phonebooth.

I'm really not sure whose idea it was to use literally every trope in the book but they really didn't hold back any punches. The film almost felt like a video game but not in the ways it should have. Most of the action scenes were laughable and seemed poorly thought out and executed with something predictable waiting around every moment of silence, suspense, and punchline. The interactions and dialogue between characters we're lack luster added close to nothing for character development. It's clear the creators just wanted the main crew to be a bunch of bad asses but that fell flat as well. The costumes and cgi were not that bad, and neither was the set, this was probably my favorite thing about the film, I just really wish they would've done something more with all that. Honestly, this movie would have been so much better if it weren't so predictable; Like I said: every trope in the book. If you can get passed this though, then you should give it a watch, otherwise I guess it serves as mildly disturbing background noise, if you're into that sort of thing.

review_title: Not as bad as some say. ... should have had a cinema release
review_detailed_main:
I have given this movie 10 stars to make up for some of the overly negative reviews.

Now my true rating is a much more positive 7/10.

In some repects this movie is far more respectful to the original game (fireball shooting baddies, health packs, weapons upgrades (chainsaws) and different coloured key cards) than the Dwayne Johnson film.

Where this film loses marks is the fact that there are no really big name actors ... actually that is unfair because there was absolutely nothing wrong with the quallity of the acting, none of the acting was as hammy as The Rock in the last Doom movie. In fact where this movie lost marks (to me) was the number of British actors who were required to talk with American accents, FFS please let them talk in their own accents rather than in a generic US accent . If the money men had done their job better to raise a bit more cash then maybe they could have had an A-lister or two so that they would have had a proper cinema release rather than being direct to video.

Technically this movie is 10/10 Sound 10/10 CGI 10/10 SFX 10/10 Costume/Prosthetics 10/10

Artistically this movie is Acting 10/10 Story 9/10 (there was something missing) Editing 10/10 Cinematography 10/10 (not the 11/10 needed for an Oscar)

Would I watch again ... yes!

review_title: an okay way to pass one hour and a half
review_detailed_main:
An okay way to pass one hour and a half.

This movie gets a lot of bad reviews, by i guess die hard fans of the doom video games.

Yes i guess the title says it all doom annihilation, but you need to take this movie for what it is and not to seriously.

Its a semi low budget science fiction action horror movie, to be honest the special effects are really good, they are not asylum type grade Z CG, ships, base etc are all really well made.

My only issue with this movie was the actors, they are not very good and not convincing at all, i did not feel anything for anyone of them and except for Mandylor.who is a b movie actor the rest of the cast is virtually unknown.

Its an okay way to pass the time if you like SCI FI and horror with good FX give it a go.

And you thought the one with the Rock in was bad! I really must stop watching movies because of nostalgia for video games from my youth! Awful story, pretty abysmal acting and the lure of seeing Doom guy blowing away demons with a shot gun is short lived and not to mention hugely disappointing.

Starts bad, and doesn't get any better. I'll watch the 2005 version all day before I watch 30 seconds of this one again. Don't even get me started on the ending. As a fan of horror I sat through hoping this would get better, but it never did. Do not listen to anyone giving this a positive review. Save your time and watch literally anything else.

Imagine a studio decided to remake the last Doom film to grace our screens, except they had no money, no actors and no substantial plot or character development and you've pretty much got Doom: Annihilation.

Whilst there are a few Easter Eggs thrown in to keep the die hard Doom fans somewhat entertained, the cannon fodder characters, utterly predictable plot and an incomprehensible amount of checking if people are alright in the middle of a battle makes you feel like shooting the BFG into your own face.

Lt. Joan Dark (Amy Manson) was the only real thing that stood out in the entire film, and you could see they blew the VFX budget on the last scenes, which somewhat make up for the 90 odd minutes of your life lost in the run up.

Maybe one for the utterly bored fans of the F Doom series but not really much else can be found on Phobos.
This movie is just awful, from the acting to the plot middle an end. I didn't expect much, I always enjoyed playing the game on PC but this movie just took it to a new low. Would not recommend

This movie is one of the best in the low-budgeted-sci-fi-horror-movies category, believe me I've seen far worst movies than this. Now I don't have prior knowledge that it was video game adapted movie, but it took me by surprise. The effects/CGI was really good considering the budget, the acting's decent except for few of the actors eg Veronica actress.

It's a bit predictable tho 'cause you can tell right from the beginning those who will die and survive. And I found ending to be ridiculous.

Overall it deserve more than 1 or 2 stars that most of the reviewers gave.

review_title: Can it be lower than 1 star?
What in the heck was even that...

review_detailed_main:
There's a lot of hate for this film and I don't know why? This is obviously a straight-to-DVD film but everyone in the reviews, treat it like it was a summer blockbuster.

I thought this film was tremendous for the budget they obviously didn't have. The story was really good, entertaining and true to the original games. The acting from the female lead and the antagonist were surprisingly good. The lead was strong, believable whilst the antagonist underplayed their character which suited the character.

CGI was really impressive, again for the budget, and the creature effects were reminiscent of 90's creature effects like from the Guyver films - which are very nostalgic for me.

In summary, a really fun B-movie! If you like b-movies and Doom and don't have big studio expectations, this is a great 90mins. It's the kind of film where if I were a Hollywood exec, I'd watch this and think the film is amateur, however, the director, writer, lead, antagonist and CGI/creature effects team have great promise in the industry.

review_title: Doesn't deserve such a low rating.
review_detailed_main:
The sets are great, and the writing, acting, special effects, and cinematography are passable. None of it was bad enough to yank me out of the narrative. The music was decent, but some metal would have made it feel more like Doom.

A few of the action beats felt weak and the very end left a little to be desired, and I'm sure the budget is to blame. It feels just as cheap as the 2006 movie, but it has more gore and faith to the source material.

Overall, I stayed entertained. I appreciated the faithfulness and I loved the Hell sequence late in the film, which I thought looked great.

Scrolling through the reviews, I'm seeing a lot of complaints about the fact that the lead character is a woman. I don't care. "Doom Guy" is a blank slate in the games and I honestly don't give a crap who fills his shoes. It's not like this scrawny little woman is pulling off absurd feats of strength. She's pulling triggers on guns.

I've seen reviews call the movie "feminist," just because the lead is a woman. Gender is NEVER brought up in the film in any way. There is no "girl power" message or equal rights agenda being pushed in your face. It's just an action movie where a small percentage of the gun-toting cast is female. I'm not insecure enough with my gender to get upset by this.

I even saw one review that only brings up one negative: the marines say "clear" a lot. Really? People are so eager to hate this movie that they start nitpicking military protocol that's in every movie with soldiers in it?

I came for demons and gore and that's what I got, with the badass Hell sequence being a cherry on top.
I give everything with negitive reviews a chance but dammmn. They are right.

review_title: I never give one star reviews but......
review_detailed_main:
This is a movie made in a warehouse using personal computer adobe workshop graphics. And the person who did the graphics wrote and directed the movie, I believed all at the same time(not true but the movie feels that way).

There is not a tired cliche missed, movie is almost like a bad parody of Aliens with a college film budget. Just don't.

No matter who played the man from every single Doom game ever made, this movie would have been bad. That said, the choice of casting here certainly did not help, at all. Do we really need yet another franchise where the main protaginists gender is changed? Are women out there REALLY clamoring for a female doom-guy? No. Ripley from Aliens was an incredible female lead, why? An original character. Joan "the freak" Ferguson from Wentworth, incredible female main character.....original. Janeway from StarTrek Voyager? Another great female lead. Brienne of Tarth from GOT, INSANELY AMAZING female character. Why the libs of Hollywood feel the need to keep swapping out established male roles with women, just for ticking the "girl power" box, is beyond me. Furthermore, whats with the casting? A 90lb girl whose 4ft nothing, is not exactly convincing as a badass. Would you cast Rick Morannis to play Braveheart? How about Elijah Wood as Thor?? It undermines women's push for more representation when, instead of creating new, fresh, original characters....Hollywood insists on just swapping out men for girls in established male franchises.

review_title: Disappointing, boring, poorly written and frustrating
review_detailed_main: This was easily the worst film made since Dracula 3000. Don't watch this poor excuse of a film, you will begin to evaluate every life choice you ever made that could have contributed to viewing this movie. It makes Doom (2005) look like it was directed by Kubrick in comparison.

After seeing this on Netflix, I have to agree this is so bad, it makes the original film look good. The main heroine, Lt. Joan Dark, is a bland heroine who fails to make as much of an impact that sci-fi heroines like Ellen Ripley and Sarah Connors made. Also, the acting is horrible, the monsters and CGI make the movie look like it was made with a low budget, and the fact that Amy Manson made an infamous tweet insulting the legend that is the Doomguy, and I can see why id Software disavowed this space junk posing as a film. Avoid at all costs.

What the hell was this...... !?

Bad acting, bad script, bad everything.... I felt I was watching something that came out of the Power Rangers 😖

I found out about this movie when i seen it on some movie news site I can't remember what site I heard about this movie let me tell you this was a great movie to me and I didn't know it was low budget and that's what made this so special the effects and effort was there this story didn't land flat to me it was great and I felt inside the doom universe all the way I also got resident evil vibes from this movie well done thank you to the actors director all who helped make this movie come to fruition thank you!
Pretty good low budget sci-fi film with decent acting, effects and some fight scenes. Overall very watchable if you don't get your expectations too hyped up. I liked it, would watch a second one.

review_title: No One is Allowed to Leave
One of the worst movies I've ever seen.
review_detailed_main:
This movie is not intended for young women. It's intended for young men. Women don't play DOOM. They never did and they never will.

So the fact that every male in this movie is only as tough as a fingernail model makes me wonder what the agenda is here. The agenda is to demasculinize young men.

Another reason being old isn't such a bad thing. I could have had to grow up with this foolishness.

Besides the bad acting, a team of scientists deconstructed a man and reconstructed "THEM".

I wonder what lame-brained Liberal girlie wrote this script. They couldn't say they reconstructed "HIM". And if it were a woman, I suspect she would have been referred to as "THEM" as well.

This gender-neutral nonsense is ridiculous. HIM and HER are apparently offensive terms now - because .000000000000000001% of the population are offended by the words.

Wait until somebody becomes offended by "the" and "and".

Here's a quote from another review I like:

"No Doom Guy. There was a cameo of the guy from Wolfenstein, but he was dead. Just a bunch of SJW schlock. Doom Girl was all of 90 Pounds, about 12 years old, and was running around beating up 240+ pound dudes and demons. What a bunch of crap.

Playing the "Doom: Annihilation" Drinking Game is quite easy. You and your friends simply need to take a drink each time a character in the movie shouts "Clear!". While watching this movie, you get the impression that they sent the cast for a day of "military training" and shouting "Clear!" every thirty seconds is all they learned to do.

review_title: A big disappointment for all video game fans
review_detailed_main:
Being a DOOM video game fan, I was curious about this movie. Since I watched the trailer I already knew that this was not going to be a nice product. I decided to give it a shot anyway. DOOM Annihilation looks and feel very cheap: locations lacks on details, for monsters seems that they used discount costumes, guns had an horrible design, especially the BFG9000, seemed a toy plastic gun.

Acting is awful, I don't know where they find these actors, but most of all, I would like to know why they had the british accent. DOOM was developed in America in the 90s, the DOOM 2016 video game had actors with american accent, why they decided to put british actors on this movie? It does not make any sense. Usually I would pass on this detail, but not in this case.

The most iconic character of the game is naturally the DOOM guy, and here there is not, at least in the 2005 movie with The Rock, they tried to make something that remembered him. Here, instead, we found again on front of the necessity to have a female hero, that will save the day. I am not against it, and I always support writers that creates positive female characters, but in this specific case, you are just ruining the spirit of the original concept.

Truth is that DOOM is not easy to adapt into a movie, because the game itself does not have lot of plot: it is just a guy that fights against demons that are trying to annihilate the Earth. It would be nice if for once they would decide to create a real nice narrative universe that explains the origin of these demons, but it needs to be a well written script.

By watching this movie, I really reevaluated the 2005 one that was better conceived. This is just a bunch of really bad stunt scenes mixed to very cheap CGI, which, for a movie of this kind is essential. I think that people that worked on the movie,already knew that this was going to be a bad movie, so they simply put a really famous name on the title and then released it.
Dora the explorers and Cybil the blue haired troll are under attack from rubbery, flame spewing Baby Crota's. This should be a free YouTube film. +1 for being slightly better then CW's Bat woman.

review_title: A game movie not even a fan would like.
review_detailed_main:
Its a complete mystery to me why anybody would want to watch DOOM: ANNIHILATION. It is, literally, the same DOOM plot extant since, what, 1993? About the only "new" feature is that the "portal" through which the baddies come is an interplanetary, possibly interstellar, teleportation device. NOT a significant addition if it is, in fact an addition, and I'm not certain that it is.

If you're a DOOM fan, then you've seen this exact same thing many times in many games and movies.

If you're NOT a DOOM fan, then DOOM: ANNIHILATION simply reads as THE WALKING DEAD on Phobos except without any real plot.

Literally, and I mean LITERALLY, you could just watch a DOOM gameplay recording on YouTube and see EXACTLY the same thing: "So, BLAM BLAM BLAM, read BLAM BLAM BLAM, any BLAM BLAM BLAM, good BLAM BLAM BLAM, books BLAM BLAM BLAM, lately BLAM BLAM BLAM?"

NOT interesting, NOT engaging, NO new territory covered, the ULTIMATE in predictability and repetitiveness. The PAINFULLY obvious ending SO apparently leaving the door "open" for a (God forbid) sequel takes the word "tedious" to a whole new scale.

Tiresomely, there were "cameo" appearances by a sawed-off, double-barreled shotgun and the infamous BFG9000 in the hopes that supposed fanboys would maybe get a stiffy. In the DOOM games at least, the lucky recipient of a BFG9000 blast would get blown entirely to pieces. In THIS movie, all that happens is targets fall down like narcoleptics. They couldn't even get that right. They actually did the same old thing, only wrong.

I kept thinking, "Surely they're not gonna do this, right? NOBODY is going to make this story AGAIN with absolutely NOTHING new or interesting in it? NOBODY would do that, right?"

Yep. It turns out that somebody would.

From the very first DOOM game, one of the more interesting elements in its intrinsically repetitive nature was the presence of really weird, surrealistic monsters, like giant, floating heads with huge horns and teeth. All of the human zombie-things were just sort of background decoration for ambience. I kept hoping to see some interesting monsters in DOOM: ANNIHILATION thinking that at least that might alleviate some of the tedium.

But no. Just interminable periods of waves of human zombies all shot in more or less the same way and occasionally stabbed with a pig sticker for "variety". In terms of monsters, all we get are fixed-teeth "demons" that are just guys in rubber suits striking "kewl" poses.

Disclaimer: I was a HUGE DOOM fan. In 1993. This movie has caused me to retroactively detest it. It's that bad.

It's just a cheap and nasty rip off of the 2005 movie "Doom" staring the Rock. While some of the action is ok, so much more of it was utter rubbish, and the same can be said of the acting. I know a lot of films leave it open at the end for a follow on, but I hope that no one is stupid enough to follow this one up. I could probably write a lot more about this film, but to be honest, it's just not worth the effort, except to say, DON'T BOTHER WATCHING.

review_title: Doomed from watching this Doom film
review_detailed_main: I enjoy the Doom franchise films until today. Doom: Annihilation lacks action. The scenes were painfully slow, full of monotonous talking and no consistent storyline. Overall, this Doom addition is a let down in my humble opinion.

I really don't understand the negative criticism. Star Wars 7 and 8 were trash. This movie, with some flaws that could be improved with a greater budget, was amazing! A great script, characters you grow to feel attached to, and realistic sensible plot. Seriously, it's like the negative reviewers didn't even watch the movie. I got on IMDB because I expected this to be one of the few low-budget movies with a high rating. What do I find instead? It's been sabotaged with low reviewers for absolutely no good reason. Movie deserves an 8 for amazing acting, scripting, and director. Only downside were that the props and some cgi could be better.

review_title: An adequate return to the Doom franchise.
review_detailed_main: I watched this movie called Doom: Annihilation. Based on the videogame we all used to play. And unlike the first attempt at the franchise, it was actually pretty good. It was filmed in Bulgaria on what was probably the catering budget for one of the Star Wars movies. It followed the game philosophy pretty well. The sets and actors weren't expensive but they weren't horrible either. CGI and special effects were not spectacular but quite adequate to move the story along. All in all I quite enjoyed it! A solid B movie that would have done ok as the second feature at the drive-in.

review_title: Too bad to be even funny
review_detailed_main: When the first information was revealed that there will be new "DOOM" movie in the makes, I was thinking "Oh man, surely it will be better than the one with Dwayne in it!"

review_title: 0 stars if I could, actually I'd love to give it negative stars.
review_detailed_main:
The movies is so generic that it plays like a B grade zombie movie, except it's not exciting, its not funny, and there is zero nudity.

I decided to end my night with this movie after Netflix recommended it. I mean hey, I'm a gamer, i enjoy video game movies. I have even been known to enjoy the double dragons and Mario movies occasionally. I've seen the Doom movie with the Rock, and I actually liked that one despite its flaws. Okay so back to this movie, I've wasted about 90 minutes of my life. Watching the "strong female lead with a troubled backstory" cliche that has overrun cinema has ruined yet another franchise honestly. This movie should of been Doomguy or Doomgal just destroying these demons and having some of the franchise mainstays in there, maybe even some easter eggs or nods to classic Doom. It is none of that, just 90 minutes of time you can never get back.

The film is cheap, slow, underlit, boring and predictable. Don't recommend. That said, the incel outrage seen in other reviews over the film having a female lead is quite entertaining, so 2 stars rather than 1!

Scientists on Phobos are using ancient unknown stones to develop teleportation but it brings horrors and danger. Marines arrive in response to a distress call. Lt. Joan Dark is hated by her troupes. Upon arrival, they find a few survivors and the base under attack by the scientists who turned into monsters. This is a straight to video product and one could probably find it streaming somewhere. It's not particularly anything good. The actors are bland. The story is unimaginative. It starts well but the movie quickly stalls. Non of the characters are that compelling and the actors are second tier. It's a video game movie and nothing more than that.

The question is: How do you still invest in "plots" like this? It's a LOST investment! When will they learn? So many heroine women, history to be told and the "producers" INSIST in making films by misrepresenting characters and creating disturbances just to carry out "PROGRESSIVE" orders ????

And the profit? STOP IT!!!

review_title: A waste of time for everyone involved in the production
review_detailed_main:
Yet another movie adaptation of a huge videogame turns out horrendous, because the wealth of source material is as usual, ignored.

What is Doom? Going by the 2016 reboot that delves much deeper into the lore. It's about a race of humanoid beings from a dimension similar to or shared with Hell and it's demons. These humanoid beings fought against the forces of hell for centuries using primitive weapons (spears, swords) and had inhuman strength fuelled from the dimension itself. One apparent remaining soldier known as Doom slayer; a white humanoid male in a green power suit of sorts ends up on earth, after the UAC's scientific team led by a shady head scientist with ulterior motives, unlocks a portal to Hell on Mars during an excavation. An invasion of the demons to Mars and then Earth ensues, and the Doom Slayer awakens in a UAC lab and suits up, then uses an array of powerful weaponry both primate and futuristic to do what their race does best; kill the demons. They have minimal support from the outmatched UAC marines and an elusive shunned scientist Samuel Hayden, that had their brain or likeness put into a large robotic body.

What is this film then? A female UAC marine and her team residing on Mars, use plastic looking assault rifles, one marine uses an LMG that makes a whirl sound like the games minigun despite being an LMG, bizarrely. And even the infamous BFG 9000, which is portrayed as a pathetic weapon in the movie. They use these weapons to take on..2 of the franchises weakest demons (possessed humans, that look like blue vampires in this, and imps, that look like people in rubber Halloween costumes). But they are at least on Mars and an excavation does at least reveal portals that unleash the demons. There's a head scientist named after the one in Doom 3 that came out about 15 years ago (why not use source material from the lore rich reboot 3 years ago?) The head scientist being the only character from the franchise, looks nothing like the character however, and no other character from the source material...including the Doom Slayer, you know, which the whole franchise pivots on, is even in the movie. The premise without any spoilers (not that there's an ounce of this movie to spoil) is the marine woman helps stop the paltry demon invasion with her team.

What do we have then? A B-movie in every sense of the word that very loosely follows the story of the game and pays hardly any attention to the source material. Til the point it is an insult to have the franchises name on the films cover. There is a strong trend currently of taking existing franchises, particularly those with white male leads and replacing them with female leads of an often misandrist nature. Although the producers made a tweet inciting this, the movie doesn't have any of the typical dialog and story arc that show this. It is just a case of it being a bad film and paying no attention whatsoever to the franchise itself. Had an original movie been made with this lead character and some original idea's, maybe it would've faired better. Original idea's cease to exist nowadays though and this is the result, avoid.

Granted, the 2005 "Doom" movie wasn't a masterpiece, but at least it was watchable and enjoyable for what it was - a movie based on an old game franchise.

Naturally, I dreaded sitting down to watch this 2019 movie titled "Doom: Annihilation", especially since I never even heard about it prior to getting the chance to watch it. But still, as a movie buff, of course I took the time to sit down and watch it, believing in giving every movie a fair chance.

Turns out that this 2019 movie by writer and director Tony Giglio wasn't particularly impressive in any way. Sure, it was carrying the "Doom" title and is an addition to the franchise, but hardly a noticeable or worthwhile addition.

The movie feels low budget - you know that particular feeling that you get from certain movies that you watch. Some like this, of course, but I can't really claim to say that I am much of a fan of that, and it wasn't working in favor of the movie.

Now, the cast in "Doom: Annihilation", was for the majority of the entire cast, unfamiliar actors and actresses, which is something I do like. So that counted for something and worked in favor of the movie, despite it being unable to make up for the movie's shortcomings and flaws.

The storyline was straight forward and require no brain activity to follow, for better or worse. It was good in the sense that you just sit down and watch this, not having to invest anything in it aside from time and whatever money wasted on renting or purchasing it. But on the other hand, it was so completely derivative and generic that it was bordering on being downright boring and laughable.

The CGI in the movie was fair for the most parts, despite the fact that the fire wielding and throwing creatures looked like something from a 1990s computer game. It was near impossible to take those creatures serious in any way.

As in terms of enjoyment and entertainment, then "Doom: Annihilation" is a weak entry in cinema. It hardly offered anything of any worth or value, and most definitely didn't bring anything new to the genre of movie adaptations based on computer games. Some times, you just stop and wonder 'why do they even make movies based on these games?'

I endured the movie to the end. And while we are mentioning the end, then I will say that the ending here was a slap to the face with a cold, dead fish for us in the audience that actually gave the movie a chance and attempted to like it.

All in all, "Doom: Annihilation" manages to score a meager four out of ten stars from me.

review_title: Been a Doom fan since the 2004 PC game & 2005 film
review_detailed_main: The movie felt low-budget. More CGI was needed. I'm giving it 8/10 w/ the hopes that there'll be a next Doom movie. The haters are ungrateful; at least we got a movie to watch. Please make another movie w/ more funding. The actors were fine and the storyline was decent. The ending was good. 8/10.

review_title: A formulaic plot, but exactly what I was expecting
review_detailed_main:
When I think Doom, I always have in mind Doom 1 and 2, the original games, with the silly pixelated sprite animation and the weird sounds and music. It wasn't so much horror as cheesy action. So when you get another low budget movie called Doom, you can't really expect much. Silly weapons, evil demons, lots of shooting. And that is what you get, with some typical horror plot thrown in of experimentation with alien technology on Phobos, the compulsory arrogant scientist with a British accent, the brave soldier - which in this case is the really cute Amy Manson - and some bad CGI.

Is it scary? Nope. You see everything coming a mile away. Is it funny? No. It takes itself seriously for some reason. It borrows the game elements: the levels, the weaponry, the colored key cards, and uses them in the plot, like they were supposed to make sense. Is the action amazing or the background story captivating? No. Like a blockbuster or a McDonald's burger, It's exactly what you would expect, with absolutely no surprises. The best part of the movie was how cute Amy Manson was.

To sum up the quality of this film, the main actress' name is spelled incorrectly in the opening credits. Yeah - that's the level of competency coming at you here.

Don't get your hopes up if you're a Doom fan. You'll only be hurting yourself.

I have it a 2 for SOME of the CGI. You'll know which bits. They're few and far between.

One good thing: you'll have a whole lot of love in retrospect for The Rock's Doom movie after seeing this.

review_title: The ending sealed it....One of the worst sci-fi movies I've ever watched.
review_detailed_main:
This has a few redeeming elements, but they are highly overshadowed by the bad and ridiculous elements. Conceptually solid but highly predictable. Special effects are mostly passable, but some of the "creatures" are - even though supernatural in origin - really just crazed zombies with a new paint job. And the other creatures - supposedly "demons" are on par with something from Power Rangers. Some of the acting is decent, but the characters are paper thin and some of the dialogue almost draws an eye roll. And the ending...not sure if they wanted to leave room for a sequel or if they were going for the ambiguous conclusion sometimes seen in horror films, but it is so abrupt and non-conclusive that it almost seems like they simply never finished the script or ran out of money and couldn't film the actual end.

If you're going to watch a "Doom" movie, definitely go with the one with Karl Urban and Dwayne (the Rock) Johnson.
