review_title: Why people hate "Doom: Annihilation" when it's actually a good Doom movie.
review_detailed_main:
Hi everyone, I've been a fan of Doom since I was about 10 years old. I know, it's not the most child-friendly game for that age, but I casually played it and it has been a part my deep passion for the shooter video game genre.

If you have only discovered the Doom saga with the last two games, namely "Doom 2016" and "Doom Eternal" then in my opinion you should not even watch the latest movie adaptation of the series, namely "Doom: Annihilation". But let's start from the beginning: As we know, there have been a lot of movies that tried to revive the success of various video games in a cinematographic context, but unfortunately, having money is not enough. In fact, the authors need to have the right knowledge of the work on which they have to work on and also a minimum of passion in doing so. We saw how many movies based on video games are actually garbage such as the Uwe Boll movies, just awful...

But let me tell you that "Doom: Annihilation" was created in a totally different way; in addition to having personally seen it I was also lucky enough to talk with the director Tony Giglio. This movie was born because him is a true FAN of the genre, and not only Doom but also a fan of all the best old school FPS of few decades ago. Just think of the reference linked to "Wolfenstein" contained in the movie.

So you may be wondering: why was the movie judged negatively? I'm here today to try to clarify and convince you that maybe you watched this movie from a totally wrong perspective. Let's start from the beginning: Universal is the famous movie production company that currently holds the rights to produce a Doom movie. Therefore, it should be specified that these rights are limited exclusively to the old Doom games, which are: "Doom (1993)", "Doom II", "Doom 64" and "Doom 3"; this is a fundamental point since many people have unfortunately known the video game only through the 2016 "reboot" by Bethesta company (This videogame company does not want to sell the rights to a movie based on the games "Doom 2016" and "Doom Eternal" for the moment).

But in my opinion, this is not necessarily a bad thing. It can be for many who would like to see the Doom Slayer in frenetic scenes where he rips off demons with metal music and that's it. I have certainly appreciated all the Doom videogames released so far, but I always consider the classic Doom games as the best.

Returning to Universal, this has certainly shown interest for an attempt to launch the Doom brand also in cinematographic context, but unfortunately it immediately failed with the flop of the famous movie with The Rock, and if we wanted to talk about this for a moment, I personally appreciated that movie, but it has obvious problems that cannot be ignored. I could go deeper, but we are here for Doom Annihilation and I would not like to dwell too long.

Now let's get to it: Tony Giglio's movie"Doom: Annihilation" comes from a completely different pretext: the pure desire to do it, and at any cost! A passion that is hardly found in these contexts, so if you thought that Universal had produced this new movie to try to make money by spending little money, you are totally off track. The company has never proposed on its own initiative a new attempt to capitalize on the success of Doom franchise, in fact this movie exists only because an ordinary director wanted it, and somehow managed to get a small budget to work on it (really small).

Now I'm going to talk about the movie itself; It's a movie that pays homage to the original story of the very first Doom videogame, more than it seems! But it also takes a lot from "Doom 3" and "Doom 64". Previously, the doomguy was not definable as a character, but the representation of the player in the role of the Doom marine, who is the only survivor of his group, and this is exactly the initial incpit!

A group of marines is sent to the Martian base "Phobos" following a mysterious invasion. Then all the marines, except one, are killed by demons. So when it comes to Doom story, we know that all the characters are destined to end badly, except for the protagonist. The problem is that many people consider Doom a game based exclusively on an iconic character, but that's because Id software under Bethesda developed the story in this way, effectively creating the Slayer. But we must remember that the doomguy WAS mainly an ordinary marine who proved to be more skilled, and for this reason destined to face the demons.

In the movie we have as protagonist the lieutenant "Joan Dark". There would be many things to say about her, for example that it is also a reference to "Joan of Arc", but for this there is already another article written by other people. But what you only need to know is that she is the purest representation of the doomguy in this movie, as she is the only marine who proves to be able to get to hell. We can define her as doomgirl.

I really appreciated the fact that the doomguy is not a specific character, but that he or she is the one who could get to the point of facing and defeating the demons. The starting point of the story of all dooms has always been this. We're not talking about a series like Duke Nukem that is mainly based on a specific character, namely the "Duke", and I think this is the best example: "making a movie based on Duke Nukem without Duke Nukem" that would be ridiculous. Doom is not like that. Now let's talk about the remaining of the plot: very faithful to the concept of teleportation and demons trying to invade the earth.

I could talk for hours about how the antagonist of Doom 3 "Dr. Malcolm Betruger" is the most apt for this context, and how it has been adapted perfectly, going from being a character in a videogame to becoming the character of a movie, but I'm trying not to make this review too long, this to make sure that it is read by many people, so I could go deeper on another occasion. Speaking of demons, their appearance is clearly based on the chapter dedicated for the Nintendo 64 console, namely "Doom 64" (We even have the arch-vile!).

In addition to this, you can see all the stuff that seem to come directly from the classic Doom videogames such as: colored keys, the medical station, the portals of the archaeological excavations and the BFG with its GREEN plasma concentrate (unlike the BLUE version of the first movie)!

So, you can see that the author is a true fan of the classic Doom videogames, and has managed with a very small budget to make a movie definitely SUPERIOR to many shitty projects with millions of dollars wasted. It is clear that, in this movie, many action scenes do not shine in terms of spectacularity, but everything possible has been done to manage the little money available.

Doom is my favorite shooter saga ever, and I enjoyed this movie as a tribute to this wonderful and spectacular saga. I much preferred a "poor" movie rather than nothing or a movie maybe with spectacular special effects but without the true soul of the video game. What I don't realize is that the only way to get more out of this is to start supporting and showing appreciation for small projects like this. Only then will studios like Universal decide to pour lots of money, but we must also be able to recognize the enormous difference between video games and movies. Even the ending (without spoilers) is very faithful to the original story; do you remember what happens at the end of the very first chapter of The very first Doom videogame? "Knee-Depp in the Dead"?

Here. I would be really excited about a sequel. There was also the question of the fact that "ID Software" claimed not to be involved in development, but thank f**k I would say... ID Software works on videogames, they are not workers in the cinematography industry and has simply claimed an obvious thing. This means absolutely nothing, I have always found it ridiculous to bring up this fact just to criticize the existence of the movie. Like it or not as it should be, tastes are tastes. The problem is when people criticize in a "objective way" even though they are not experts of the original work.

This movie is in fact a small tribute, wanted by a fan, who certainly wanted to reinterpret the formula of the game in his own way, but this in the right way and with little money available. Try to see it for what it is and you will realize how beautiful and profound this movie is for us true fans.

review_title: More faithful to the source material
review_detailed_main: Sure, Hollywood has been working on getting video game based movies better, like Detective Pikachu, Angry Birds Movie 2, but there's always a hickup along the way. What is really good about this movie is that it is far more faithful than the atrocity Dwayne Johnson was in. This movie would have been horribly received and wouldn't be able to recoup it's budget if more work was done to the movie if it was released into theaters, but still have the same plot, story, and characters at the same time. For a direct to video movie, it's not that bad. Yes, it doesn't have the Doom guy in it, which would be amazing. You have to at least give the people credit for trying with this. I enjoyed it overall.
The acting seemed akan to a on stage perfermance in comparison to a lot of other movies. Monsters lacked imagination. The first 'Doom' was better.

If there's ever been a cliche in any cheapo sci-fi movie, you'll find it here. With no-name actors, wooden script, and well-below average special effects, it's completely laughable and as exciting as a dead roach in a public restroom.

There's not enough weed to make this watchable unless you're on the low end of the spectrum for idiocy.
Take the plot for Aliens, then add the monsters from Resident Evil. This was such a cheap knockoff I couldn't even finish the film.

review_title: What was the budget? A box of twinkies?
review_detailed_main:
When the captain grabbed the escape hatch handles to turn them and the whole thing bent in his hands it was obvious this was going to be a cheap piece of crap movie. I think the studio seems to have forgotten that most people these days know how small military units are supposed to move. Did they even have a military advisor on set? The actors stumble around like a bunch of drunk college kids, flagging each other with their weapons, tripping over their own feet. If this is the stuff they left in the movie, how bad was the stuff cut out I wonder. Watching them go down the first ladder was cringe inducing. Did they even rehearse the scene? It was obvious the actors had no idea what they were doing as they tried to figure out what to do with their props while they climbed. It has nothing to do with the game Doom either.

AVOID THIS MOVIE!
A bad combination/rip off of Alien and Resident Evil. Bad acting, writing and directing. Don't pay to see this movie, wait until it's free.

review_title: Barely okay for a Direct-to-Video Movie
review_detailed_main: For a low budget direct-to-video movie, this isn't actually bad. I could've enjoyed it much more had it a bit more decent acting from the characters. Some cheesy and horrible acting make the tense moment funny. The CG effects aren't that horrible considering the budget, the last CG-filled part is surely better enough than what I imagined. There were a lot of continuity errors, like in one scene you can see the protagonist's hair is wet and in one style, and immediately when she turns her head, it's dry and in a different style. There are tons of errors like this that are easy to spot. The trailer of the film was deceiving. It certainly is much better than that garbage of a trailer. Now onto the main part, as an adaptation of a game, how is it? Well, nope, not good. It is an okay horror film, but the only few related things with the games are the aesthetics. The setup is not even the same as the main game story. You can take it as a side-story, but it still doesn't relate to the game's story at all. Overall, for a direct-to-video movie, yeah it's enjoyable.

I was unaware that a new doom movie was made but here we are with another doom film. It's "clear" and obvious this films had a lot problems but the budget was clearly missing. It feels like the film was plagued with bad acting and bad direction from the get go. Most likely money was funneled and they were left with maybe a $8 mil project.

review_title: Don't listen to the bad reviewers, who have never played the original game
Not nearly as bad as most of the reviews here make it seem! Actually entertaining and respectful of source material!

review_detailed_main: What happened to the ending for the love cinema. If you like shoot em up zombie movies with terrible endings , enjoy...

D list actors. Plot points stolen from Stargate. Asinine dialogue. What more could one want in a movie?... No one should waste 90 minutes of their life watching this horrid "film". But on the bright side, it makes the Doom film with the Rock look good in comparison.

I liked-ish the first DOOM, watched it several times through the years. I ran across this title today and watched it. It was different... it kept me entertained and was worth the 96min. They done well for the little they spent to make it

review_title: Who looked at this and said "yeah."

review_detailed_main:
Take a shot every time someone says "clear"

You'll be legless before you know it

All the Doom fanboys are marking this movie down. How ridiculous, this was a great movie and it did it's job of providing escapism for an hour and a half. Watch for your self is my motto, can't go by reviews all the time because I usually prove them wrong. Give it a go and don't join the stupid band wagon going on here.

review_title: I actually quite enjoyed this for what it is
review_detailed_main: In comparison to the older doom movie, this is way more doomy. Still, just a mindless b-movie, but when you can overlook, that they did not have much money to produce this, it actually looks and feels like a cheesy story from a 90ies fps game and is fun to watch.

Years ago, I rated Doom with 1 star, and this is just a little worse. Unfortunately, I can't go any lower than 1.

They really took sci-fi literally, and didn't bother to make anything realistic. Creatures that took 10 rifle shots die to 4 pistol shots; a pistol that couldn't have been high caliber since it fired about 20 bullets. Fireballs don't burn people. They just get bloody everywhere. All the bodies except for the special cases are intact, with blood smeared on them. A traumatized woman that wouldn't even speak somehow becomes calm and coherent as soon as she meets up with another character that she's not even close to.

The story feels like Rogue One, where nothing substancial actually happens, and it ends in a direction which is supposed to be a cliffhanger, but you know wat actually happens in the canon universe. The ending is just horrible, and the rest of the movie basically shows things being killed.

I think some parts of the movie tried to have twist, mystery, or sci-fi factor. All of it felt like whatever. There were some stunts which they expected to pass for action. It didn't. The MC was more lucky than John Wick, and pretty much lacked as much in skill, as in they pretty much survived by blind luck, or just so they could get to that terrible ending.

Take every element that goes into making a movie - Script, acting, directing, costume, sets...etal. and this one does all of them in the worst way possible. One of the worst all time films I have ever seen, and I've seen some really bad ones. Having a root canal without pain killers would be more desirable.

review_title: Primary School Student Could Do Better
review_detailed_main:
Here is the film in bullet points:
They ruined the story of Doom video game - unbelievably!
Plot is completely childish!
Acting is poor!
The film is a real PC film!
Last but not least, in this film like many others, you will see the portrayal of man and women in Hollywood: Men are stupid, coward and cannot look after themselves. Women, on the other hand, are independent, strong, intelligent and never make a mistake!

To give you an idea of how this movie is put together, the "futuristic" battle rifles in this movie are just regular AR-15s and AK-47s with black plastic glued around them. This movie looks like a low-budget Sci-Fy Channel original from fifteen years ago, like Battlestar Galactica or whatever garbage was on TV back then. Cheap plastic sets, plastic-covered weapons, plastic body armor, no-name actors and cheesy lines. Skip this one and pull out the old original Doom with The Rock and have a much more enjoyable film experience.
My gaming experience is ruined. Movie is 0/10. UAC is the only thing that says "Doom"

review_title: This is not great but nowhere near as horrible as other reviews make it.

review_detailed_main: This makes the original movie look like Saving Private Ryan. It's just a generic zombie movie with a space theme and takes away the gore that makes those kinds of movies enjoyable. The BFG doesnt even blow anything up, it just pushing them back. Action is boring. Acting is mid grade B movie schlock. Guns look like cheap plastic toys. The villain's motive is as cliche as you can possibly get, you've seen it done a million times. All in all it's just a bad movie. I really dont understand why iD software would agree to have a , low budget, straight to video release of their biggest title even be made. This doesnt help the franchise, of anything it hurts it.

I am not sure what this is. This is not DOOM. Looks like someone wrote a zombie monster space movie and filled in things with DOOM names.

As a long time fan of DOOM I have no words really to explain how bad this is.

I gave this a 10 because there are way too many low ratings that are undeserved. This movie was better than the reviews, I normally don't even pay attention to these types, but this version kept me interested. If you understand that it is 1. Low budget and 2. Unknown actors, then perhaps you will enjoy it. Too many haters on here. Decent rendition, and not a waste of time to watch.

review_title: If you just want shooting and monsters it's enjoyable.
review_detailed_main:
I actually thought it was pretty good.

This is coming from someone who thinks Star Trek Picard is idiotic.

I guess I just go in with low expectations these days.

I felt it stayed pretty close to the source material. Can't really see what the other reviewers are complaining about.
Making a movie based on the original Doom game shouldn't be hard! Not much of a plot just kick ass monster, guns & a lot of killing. Not attack of the Blue Man group!

What holds this movie back is not the lack of funding, which is evident in many places - lots of re-used sets that all have to be kept as un-gritty as possible so they can be used for other places of the facility, overall looking quite painted plywood-like, bad techy bits in nonsensical arrangements and hectic, claustrophobic camera cuts that try to make the place seem larger than it is.

That's forgivable if the writing can make up for it. Sadly it can't. At all. Did you think the last Doom game had a thin plot? It is a masterpiece compared to this.

The dialogues are on the level of what hollywood generally has produced in the past years - filled with cliches, sexual references that are out of place and plain dumb, and so much idiocy that you seriously have to wonder why the humanity of the future has not yet blown itself up. Rational thinking? What's that, can you eat it? Do they hire scriptwriters out of pre-school?

Clearly the only qualification for any and all jobs - be it scientist, engineer, pilot or military personnel - is that one is able to yell incoherent things in an angry way, and try really hard to get into someone's pants. Oh and consume alcohol of course.

I've given it two stars because the exterior scenes of the ship are decenly done and of notably higher quality than the rest of the VFX shots. That still does not make this a watchable movie. If you must, fast-forward through it.

review_title: I've seen Gacha Videos Better than This
review_detailed_main: CGI looks like some highschool kid that just picked up Adobe AE. The writing was terrible. But hey at least we've got another strong female lead for dem Twitter likes.

Well I think it was almost as good as the first, the only problem here being that it appeared unannounced, no A actors and let's not forget that the first one was no good either. A straight forward movie, I guess somewhat linked to the game and that is about it.

Will not recommend it, it has nothing to show for, brings nothing new, tries nothing new, it's as bland as it possibly can be, even for fans of the first movie or of the game, it will fail to bring any kind of joy. Simply put, a movie that does not deliver.

Cheers!

review_title: Getting closer but still no cigar...
review_detailed_main: They got closer to original but still not real deal. For what it is -Its a a passable straight to dvd movie.It seems to me like they are testing the water for a full blown hell and demons movie.

review_title: My first review on IMDB ever
review_detailed_main: This is literally the worst movie I ever saw. Don't waste your time and money on it. Doesn't matter if it's "cheap" or not, it's absolut waste of time. P.S. burn all copies, bury them and fill concrete over

I think creator of DOOM game have to be thrilled of this creation - it's dark, it's simple, and capture another view of doom, and open the door to many sequels. If you know DOOM game from beginning and everything around that, that this is the right way. Thx.

It opens like a bad soft core open film and then gets worse. The one guy says he's. gone through everyone's stuff," like a perv would.

People need to stop making crap D00M films. It's ruining the greatness of D00M.

review_title: Ogden Gavanaki sounds like the name of someone who would produce this...
review_detailed_main:
The last movie I watched of 2019 was terrible. Why not start 2020 with what I expect to be a terrible movie.

How much did that actress get to stand so still in the background with her hands clasped?

That is some shoulder acting.

Joan Dark took 5 seconds to come up with.

I can tell how bad this movie will be based on how many comments I have already. Including this one.

The doctor has poor shoulder acting skills.

Clearly another Aliens take.

It's a big hunt.

I do not approve of their movements. Standing in the middle of opening doors. Not checking corners. Just terrible.

I'm gonna assume that huge backpack is for ammo.

You didn't try to tell them anything.

You're ultra nightmare. That sounds pretty bad.

After all these movies space marines really ought to start wearing mouth shields to keep the goop out.

Even if you're a fan of Doom, there is no entertainment to be found here. But if you like watching indistinguishable characters without personalities wandering around sterile hallways, shooting rubber suits and blue people with plastic guns for 90 minutes, then you might enjoy this movie. But then again, you could just watch any SyFy Channel original film for free.

The 1st DOOM movie was awesome. This installment was the exact opposite. So the story and setting was "doomey" but the "tuff guy's". Well, was so poorly cast and acted I cannot put into words just how bad it was. The LT in real life could pull the skin off a Custard. The Aussie Special Forces guy a coward, yeah right. All the chicks fort like Segal but it was so full of BS it was hard to watch. Life is too short to watch rubbish like this.

review_title: Overwhelming disappointment. Someone needs to protect the Doom IP
review_detailed_main:
Note: Game developers had nothing to do with this film. Blatantly obvious.

If you do a video game movie, you _must_ work with some creative element from the video games development otherwise you're misfiring every note.

review_title: Not sure why it was remade or why to watch
review_detailed_main: I'm the perfect demographic for a Doom movie. Middle aged male who has played the games on multiple platforms. However, this movie was not made for me. It was made for SJWs who by the large don't play Doom and most likely have never heard of it. I could go into the casting, acting, writing, sfx, etc. but, what's the point, they were all bad. So, I wouldn't recommend this movie for anyone.

review_title: Believe it or not, it's worse than the 2005 Doom
review_detailed_main:
The previous one was already in the abyss of what worse could be fuse with cinematography and video games.

Some effects are quiet good. But the movie ends where it should have started.

The only good thing is that it's not 2 hours long.

review_title: Not as bad many reviewed it.
review_detailed_main: It's watchable. Sure, you've got supernatural horror and SF mixed together. Sure, you have a politically correct female Marine who can beat up anyone, including supercharged zombies, and even demons, even though she's just an ordinary looking woman you see on the street any time of the day that can often use some help with heavy objects and reaching things on the top shelf. The space Marines as usual fail to take sufficient ammo for the situation and professionalism is sparse. And truth be told, they could have saved themselves a lot of grief using drones technology that exists today. But, the special effects aren't half bad and there's a lot of shooting.
I hope they are gona do DOOM: Annihilation 2 😁 And those who say that this movie is awful, they never saw an awful movie 🤣🤣🤣

review_title: Not as bad as people make out
What on earth were they thinking?
review_detailed_main:
Some of the worst tropes and everything is sub par compared to the last Doom offering. What the hell is going on in cinema? I just can't even understand how this stuff gets greenlit and all that money spent, no, squandered on literally crap.

There is not a single redeemable thing in this film. Nothing.
In the games it is a badass male protagonist. Why change? Every video game movie guys change everything. I think The budget isnt a big problem. The problem is the diretor chance all the main idea.

Once you're introduced to the cast of characters, you're ready to turn it off. Doomguy is a woman here for some reason when, in the actual game, the protagonist is literally named "Doomguy". The supporting cast is diverse to the point of madness and none of them are likable. I understand that diversity is important, but blatantly shoe-horning it in there isn't good for anyone.

review_title: This is the best movie of the year... Oh wait I thought we were talking about Joker

review_detailed_main:
The Doom movie from 2005 with "The Rock" Dwayne Johnson was solid, but the rather low budget showed here and there. In comparsion, Doom: Annihilation is not a total fail but it is also in no way an improvement to the version with Mr. Johnson, but rather a movie with below average quality (compared to other movies of the horror sci-fi genre).

To me Doom: Annihilation is rather a waste of a fine horror sci-fi franchise with a lot of potential. The low budget of the movie shows, and there is no real improvement neither on the plot or acting, nor regarding setting or the special effects department. Watching, my hope for a good or at least solid Doom movie was very fast destroyed.

The movie with "The Rock" I will watch some day again, Doom: Annihilation I won't. The only question left: why someone even bothered to make Doom: Annihilation!?

What is this movie ?? worst movie ever terrible acting and cartoon environment looks like they added color with paint. After watching 30 minutes of the movie couldnt tell if i was watching a zombie or Doom. garbage i dont know how bethesda allowed this movie to be made SHAME

Words cannot describe words that are not yet figured out on man's imagination on the audacity to create such a flick...I mean...is there a gas pump nearby so I can burn this thing to flames...oof, I got a headache just talking about it...OMG, the end was ......you see where I want to go...

review_title: It wasn't as bad as i thought it would be, but it's still not good.

review_detailed_main: I understand that the Dwayne Johnson doom was based on doom 3 but aside from a few coloring issues this was a great movie. Give this team enough money to make a sequel of equal or better quality because it fits with the games mythos. The sequel could be episode 2 and 3 of the freeware version of the original game. I openly admit a few cheesy lines but overall a great flick.

review_title: Not As Bad As People Say
review_detailed_main:
I love Doom. All the games. The first movie. But this could've been a lot better, honestly.

I think it's unfairly attacked, but I understand and agree with many of those attacks, like Doomguy-once again-not being in the movie. By now, he should've been. But it's hard to put Doomguy in the forefront of a sci-fi horror mystery film, and I completely understand it. Many folks are saying the female lead is an SJW thing, but I'd have to disagree. It doesn't come across like that to me, at all, but the movie definitely doesn't feel any closer to the games, as an adaptation. I get why fans would be mad. At least the first film adaptation had tons of gore and cool moments. It's very stylish, which is a plus. This film doesn't feel anywhere as cheap as most low-budget sci-fi flicks, but it certainly feels like a straight-to-DVD flick (which it is lol).

I will say this: the last ten minutes or so were awesome, and I wish the budget allowed for way more of that. THAT was what cinematic Doom's film adaptation should be more like, by the time it ends.

In the end, I'd say the film doesn't drop the ball, but it certainly struggles to hold it still.

It's a big, dumb horror science movie, and it doesn't need intelligence (just like the games).

Who in their right mind makes a movie this bad, do the actors feel any shame at all knowing that the general public will see this garbage, I truly recommend that you push this aside with the biggest barge pole you can find. No storyline, no fx, no decent dialogue and I've seen better acting at a chimps tea party, no wonder there are so many struggling actors if this is the best of their ability
The original Doom even though that flopped to is better then this I was excited for this but it's just really bad

I really love minions. Every day when I was little I would watch Despicable Me, Minions, and Despicable Me 2. My house is plastered with minion wallpaper, my carpet is just a small child's rug with a minion on it. All of my clothes are blue and yellow. My shirts are all minion merchandise. I really love minions.

What a sh#t loald of f@ck what were they thinking with this one the effects are bad the caracters are trash this makes the 2005 look like a master piece this is the worst movie i have ever seen women belong in the kitchen not in starting roles in movies everything in this movie suck evertying is horrible

I'm sure that Amy Manson (Lieutenant Joan Dark) based her character on Sigourney Weaver's Ripley from the Aliens movie, not that it's a bad thing, but it was a style that worked in the 70's-80's and didn't really work that well on this movie. Luke Allen-Gale, or should I say Daniel Jackson, did a reasonable job portraying that character, shame that it wasn't Stargate, he may have pulled it off. Overall, I would say that it just below average as some of the acting was a bit dubious. I would recommend it.

Do yourself a favor skip to 1:25 and make it a short 10m film. That's what I did I didn't watch the first 1hr 25m lolol!

Enjoy!

review_title: I want to drill a hole in my skull now
review_detailed_main:
Okay, let's get the obvious out of the way. I made a conscious decision to view a Doom movie. I saw the previous one, I love many bad movies, and I approached this one knowing it would not be a deep and intellectual piece of art.

That said, I was still surprised. Normally I can suffer through even the worst movies because why the hell not, but about 40-45 minutes into this one, I just couldn't go on.

The script is basically nonexistent, the dialogue is so ridiculous it made my testes ache, and every single key character was like a cardboard cutout of what a dead skunk smells like.

A space marine unit with a drunk pilot landing at a top secret military project site on one of the moons of Mars failing to communicate with each other or even hold their weapons in a way that doesn't look like elementary school kids playing pretend with sticks while dragging an unarmed civilian among them? Check. Cheesy nods to id software like exploding barrels and chainsaws (honestly though, I stopped watching before barrels exploded or chainsaws were used) with a corpse named Blazkowicz and a zombified scientist named Carmack thrown in? Check. Add crappy sound stage sets, sub-par visual effects, etc, and call it a day.

My head has a demon in it now. Please make it stop.

This just might be the worst movie I've ever attempted to see.

review_title: What's there to hate about this film? Humanity has gone mad, this is a flawless piece of sci-fi I have rarely seen since 1979's Alien
review_detailed_main:
Everything is good about this film. The script, the feeling, the acting (Dr Betruger was fantastically played).

I am seriously opposed to anything woke and understand that some people disliked having the male Doomguy replaced with a female counterpart, but I didn't care. I just enjoyed the story.

The first really put to the test to the limit heroine since Ellen Ripley. She literally went into the place I had been dying to explore the entire Doom franchise- beyond the alien world- Hell. We hot some answers- who they are, what do they want.

This beats Event Horizon. And that movie was a 10/10.

How the bandwagon can get together and downvote this movie to oblivion is beyond me

I watch every movie coming out since the 1970s, I have seen more than 10.000, NOTHING American is even half decent anymore. The only good movies being made anymore come from Asia (Parasyte), Italy (They Call Me Jeeg), Hungary (Kut, Kills on Wheels). People today downvote the only ones that are good!!! Like this one.

Rarely a western movie is even decent (this year I just liked the new Hercule Poirot Death on the Nile)

How is it possible that this masterpiece is rated 3, something on imdb?? Has the entire world.gone mad?

review_title: Cringy 1st 20mins, but then gets better and eventually good.

review_detailed_main:
This movie is not entirely bad, if you love Doom.

Some actors are doing bad, but the main actors are doing decent. They all should have had more training in how to move like marines, though: The reason to run with bent legs is not just to be smaller, but to be able to keep the upper body steady to have a good aim. Running around with bent legs and jumping firearms is not the way to go.

The plot and the dialog is not at all good. This looks like a medium-budget film with a low-budget writing crew. Shame on the producers for that.

If you thought the first Doom movie was bad, there is no reason to see this one. I loved the first, and give this one a pass with mediocre grade.

There's a reference to John Carmack in this movie (as in the first). If you don't know who he is, this movie is probably not for you.

Feels like it was filmed in a theme park set, put its own unappealing spin on demon-design and suffered from a very heavy dose of laughable girl-power, lacked any bad/cheap-movie charm and lacked Doomguy. Was barely able to keep attention and my eyes barely stopped rolling. At least the 2005 film, though bad, was a lot more fun.
They must not have been able to get ANY well named actors to star in the sequel and the quality of this movie showed it. All I can say is ABSOLUTE crap

review_title: It's a dumb action movie based on a video game
review_detailed_main:
There's not enough metal in the soundtrack.

Their "combat helmets" are literally just bicycle helmets with plastic moldings attached.

Um I'm watching this movie for the second time. Maybe third. It's better than a lot of other stuff on Netflix.

Doesn't mean it's good.

I'm not an existing fan of the doom series, but this movie makes me want to play it. And isn't that kinda the point? Encourage people to look into the source material?

Yeahhhh not a great movie, especially compared to the legacy of the Doom games.

It is dumb, has action, and is entertaining me.

But I'm not taking it seriously.

I'd love to see a faithful telling of the story of doom guy and his pet bunny.

Full of like hardcore metal riffs, hell bring back the pov angle from the rock movie or hardcore Henry, and just make the bloodiest goriest first person shooter movie ever.

Less story, more killing. Pull a star wars, but with the video games not books to fill in the holes. If you care to know. But like if you give us 90 minutes of like doom gameplay on screen, I'd watch it.

Not remotely surprised by all the 1 stars.

review_title: Horror themed Red Dwarf - but with worse effects
review_detailed_main: With made-for-tv visual effects, dialogue as if this was the writer's first day being human, exploring the use of language - this film scores somewhere between stepping in dog mess barefoot and dropping toast butter side down. This movie is a tragic excuse of an IP tie-in. Prepare yourself for relentless horror tropes regurgitated one after the other. Also, no Doom-Guy, replaced by a lead who is as intimidating as a fart in the wind. Want a Doom Girl - cast Gkna Carano; she'd nail it. Dumpster Hell Fire movie.

review_title: For people who rated low to this movie
review_detailed_main: You people who say the rock one was better must not have thought before saying that at least this movie is about demons and some sort of hell like the doom games. The rock one was aliens on mars and had nothing and i mean nothing to do with doom in the slightest at least this one is trying. This one at least has demons and hell in it and is trying to input doom into it were the rock one didnt even try to include any element of doom into it. So id say as a personal player of doom and reviewer this one is as close as well get to doom unlike the 2005 version which had nothing to do with doom in the slightest.

I really wanted to believe the C-rank reviews while watching this but wow. It's almost impressive how awful this movie is. They start losing people and they're still just as blase about it as when they got there. The acting is garbage and the sets look like something from the 90's but in a bad way. Anyone who can stomach this and say it was decent is used to eating actual feces.

Holy crap is this movie bad. There are so many things wrong with it that I cannot and will not waste my time mentioning as it will take all day to type it all out. The only reason I give it a 2 and not a 1 is because the budget of effects were decent for what they had to work with. Other than, this belongs in the dumpster fire. Congratulations to the director; you get an award for screwing up a super easy movie concept like Doom and somehow making it 5x worse than the previous title while trying to be serious.
Idk why everyone is so negative abt this movie, it has good effects, great cast, and a good storyline. Overall 9.5/10, but there isnt an option for that.

review_title: The action surprisingly intense, bloody gore and satisfy! A must watch horror movie! Bravo!

review_detailed_main: The only acceptable part in this movie was the computer animated final scene. Why would you make a doom 2 without any know actors when you had The Rock in the first one? And seriously, didn't they have 500 more bucks to get a real looking BFG instead of that plastic watergun?

review_title: I Can't Believe It's Not Canadian...
review_detailed_main: ...Or SYFY Channel. This was actually made in the US. But bad enough not to be. I really don't understand why this film was even made.

While it's better than the current 3.6 rating would suggest, it certainly falls short of anything special. It takes the general theme of "Starship Troopers," and fuses it with all the crappy parts of the "Resident Evil" series (which is basically everything after the first movie), and tweaks it with parts of "Event Horizon" and the video game series "Dead Space", and still manages to moderately disappoint.

The "Doom" game series has a reputation of being extremely violent, suspenseful, gory, and scary as hell. This movie does not represent any of that very well. It's well made considering the budget and everything else, but if you're a fan of the game series and the first movie, AND a fan of indie B horror movies, you might be part of a small group of people who'd actually enjoy the movie.

The acting is not good, but I've seen worse in blockbusters. The special effects are practical, for the most part, which earns a bit of respect. Some parts are genuinely creepy, and there are some direct references to the game series that are pretty cool. I like that the computer's name is "Daisy", an obvious reference to "2001: A Space Odyssey". But the writing is trash, the characters are cliche, the monsters aren't all that intimidating, and overall it's not scary at all. Some dudes in alien/demon costumes ain't gonna save this one. And it's not even that gory, so the gore hounds wouldn't feel satisfied at all.

Fun if you're with friends, and drunk or high probably, but not really worth it otherwise. Good try though, folks.

This is a cliché filled, generic film hoping to make a few extra dollars off of franchise name recognition. It does not feel at all like some agenda driven project by "the Left" but rather a poorly planned idea by someone who thought the Resident Evil film franchise is a series of masterpieces.

The writing is impossible for the actors to elevate which to some probably make the acting horrible. It feels written by someone who learned to speak English by watching Roger Corman movies. But there is really only so much the actors can do with the material given. I believe this is a first time director, at least it feels that way.

The sets are fine, but not always lit well giving some of the facades an extremely phony appearance. The special visual effects are adequate to the caliber of the rest of the movie. The practical effects are fine. It was nice to see practical blood (sometimes).

This movie truly feels like a Sci-Fi channel original film that everyone involved thought would be a theatrical release (except for the producers). This film doesn't really fit into the Doom video game lore. It works almost better as a Ghosts of Mars soft-reboot or RE: In Space.

It isn't as bad as most of the reviews make it out to be. But it still isn't good. And it doesn't quite cross that line of being so bad it's good either. Just mediocre at best.

It is currently on Netflix (Jan 2020) if you feel the need to watch it. Don't spend extra money on it.

review_title: Doom Slayer doesn't approve of this movie
review_detailed_main: Bad. Worst. The doom Slayer is on the hunt to kill this movie.

review_title: Just for the sentimental value for fans of the old computer game
review_detailed_main:
Mix the scrips from the first movie with some Alien and then forget to hire good monster make-up artists or CGI editors .. and you will end up with this "sequel" to the Dwayne Jonson movie from 2005.

Same kind of story: special team is sent to a far away place to investigate mysterious silence in communication.

The only thing that this movie did put in some effort in (imho) is the tactical movements of the soldiers. But then again, how hard can it be to navigate to some cargo containers that are light up in yellow, futuristic neon light?

I was going to give this movie a 1/10, just as an honest rating of this B-movie. But then I did enjoy seeing a female protagonist and hero that was neither skinny nor excessivly muscular. She totally out acted her male counterparts and I was almost getting a little Alicia Vikander vibes from her. Hopefully she'll be getting some better scripts in the future, to help support her efforts in front of the camera.

Also, not all scenery was totally bad - even on a minimalistic budget - but sadly you never get the all anticipated POV storytelling anywhere in this movie. Most likely also due to the small budget.

But at least, this is a little enjoyable for all of us that have spent hours and days with the game back in the days. Remembering that the graphics in the first parts of this game-universe, would make Minecraft look realistic and multidimensional. =D.

review_title: This is an insult to the franchise
There's a decent adaptation in this mess
review_detailed_main:
Let me start by saying you have to go into a movie like this with low expectations. Afterall, the track record for video game adaptations are pretty bad.

That said, the story of this version of Doom is actually pretty good. And up until the end and a few annoying expendable characters, it was pretty well executed. First of all, we actually have demons, zombies and a hint at Hell...unlike the complete absence of the Hell concept with the last one. It was as if the writers actually played the game and tried to respect it.

Of course the budget constraints were obvious. The throw away characters were horribly acted, but the main characters delivered a passable performance. I'm not a huge fan of casting a slender female in the title role for a character that has been known as "Doom Guy." The CGI for the gates are pretty laughable, but that's kind of expected.

In comparison to the Rock edition this is the Mona Lisa, it's not Amazing but c'mon it was fun, funny and had great action and a couple good jump scares better than all these lGBLT sponsored garbage out today. If you want an amazing film go see Joker if you want a fun action/horror this will be great...

review_title: Ugh, another strong woman saves the day movie without the strong woman.
review_detailed_main:
Story-wise, it's okay sci-fi. Not a whole lot of references to the Doom video game it's based on. There are only a handful of monsters from the video game rosters that make an appearance in the movie.

But the biggest crime is casting puny waif-like actresses in the roles of "special ops marines". They have no visible muscle tone AT ALL and look like the type of women glued to their smartphone all day. So, these are supposed to be marines, huh? I guess the budget was too low to hire real bad*ss females. Sad.

review_title: The only reason to give this movie a Chance
Good looking set pieces. Tv level cgi
Horrible and yet I watched it all
review_detailed_main: This is clearly a power move to women's rights and they are just as strong as men. Kill all minorities, first let the males be weak, female is the only way to your survival. Maybe directors should play the game first before making a movie about a video game.

review_title: Really? You named her Joan Dark?! (Perfect Dark rip off)
review_detailed_main: I'm 2 minutes into this movie, and the lead character is a female named Joan Dark. A total rip off from Joanna Dark in the Perfect Dark game-a completely different game title! Really?? I can tell this is going to be a rough ride, but I'm going to sit here and endure it because it's Doom. But why did they have to green light this low of production quality for such a classic game? Frustrating..

Even as a big fan of the games, and the 2005 film being a guilty pleasure, I went into this with absolutely zero expectations given its almost universally negative reception. Whilst this is by no means a good film, it ended up being surprisingly better than I was expecting. The plot generally follows the games, where scientists on Mars' Phobos moon create a teleporter that unwittingly allows an army (well, 3 or 4) demons through. A small military squad gets sent to investigate, you can guess the rest.

The effects and cgi aren't too bad considering the very limited budget, but the props and scenery are where the cheapness really shows through. It's very obvious that they only had 1 monster suit, about 5 people playing zombies and 3 sets, which they use multiple times with different lighting. The guns look like they're made of plastic and the uniforms are like something from a paintball game. But despite it's many, many problems, it does at least feel like they tried with what little resources they had. There are a fair few references to the game, some which work and some that feel completely shoehorned in (such as the "I'm your ultra nightmare" line). Ultimately though it kept me reasonably entertained for 90 minutes, so can't really ask for more than that.
